entries.title: Speaker Mike Johnson cautioned the White House that most House Republicans don’t have an appetite for extending enhanced Affordable Care Act subsidies
Army Secretary Dan Driscoll met with a Russian delegation in Abu Dhabi on Monday and Tuesday, a sign that negotiations to end the Ukraine war are in a new phase with direct talks with the Russians
The Pentagon said it is probing allegations of misconduct against Sen. Mark Kelly, a retired Navy captain, after he appeared in a video urging troops to disobey unlawful orders
President Trump’s advisers are discussing a proposal to head off sharp increases in health-insurance costs for millions of Americans next year, an issue at the heart of the recent government shutdown
Marjorie Taylor Greene’s resignation after crossing President Trump on the Epstein files underscores the dilemma other Republicans face
Municipal lawyers are stepping beyond traditional duties to challenge funding cuts by the Trump administration
Trump said he could be open to changes in the plan for ending the war in Ukraine after Kyiv, European governments and some Republican lawmakers called it too heavily weighted in Moscow’s favor
President Trump said Friday he was immediately ending temporary immigration protections for a group of Somalis living in Minnesota, the latest in his mass deportation push
Many lawmakers in Washington are growing weary of the chaotic stream of punitive resolutions from both Democrats and Republicans
Republican Marjorie Taylor Greene, who fought publicly with President Trump in recent months, says she will resign from Congress in January
The IRS acted unlawfully when it turned over tens of thousands of taxpayers’ addresses to Immigration and Customs Enforcement, a federal judge found
A Texas court upended a GOP plan that would help it hold the House, sending the Republicans to the Supreme Court
Texas asked the Supreme Court to let it use a redistricted congressional map that was blocked by a lower court and that would potentially help Republicans gain as many as five House seats
​Young voters are pessimistic about the nation’s direction, as unemployment rises and wage growth falls for the group, prompting clashes between politicians and their offspring
President Trump said he would meet with Zohran Mamdani at the White House on Friday at the New York mayor-elect’s request
U.S. elections are sending a consistent message: Americans are deeply frustrated with their government’s inability to solve problems
Trump said the Saudi crown prince “knew nothing about” the 2018 murder of Washington Post journalist Jamal Khashoggi, though the CIA at the time assessed that the royal orchestrated the killing

A classified Justice Department brief authorizing strikes on drug-smuggling boats in the Caribbean and Pacific describes fentanyl as a potential chemical weapons threat, according to people familiar with the memo
A head-to-head comparison of unmanned aircraft shows the global rivals in a close race
Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth said that the Pentagon will shake up the way it buys weaponry, equipment and software by making purchases more quickly—and from a broader range of potential suppliers.

The Trump administration is still deciding whether to push Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro out of power or extract concessions from him, according to U.S. officials familiar with the deliberations
